svcsubproc.title: Inspection for Coolant Over Temperature Conditions

step1.para: Check coolant deaeration tank for correct fill level.

item.para: If coolant level is low, look for external leaks at radiator, engine and all coolant related hoses.

step1.para: Inspect the condition of the following items: cooling fan blade, shroud, accessory drive belt, accessory drive belt tensioner, cooling fan drive clutch, and radiator.

item.para: If vehicle is new or recently repaired, verify the correct part number for any component related to the cooling system.
Verify that cooling fan blade, cooling fan drive clutch, and radiator are clean of debris and dirt build-up. Clean areas as required.

caution.para: To avoid radiator damage, when using high pressure washer, be careful not to get wand to close to radiator fins.

step1.para: Install Electronic Service Tool (EST) and check for active and inactive Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTC) related to engine coolant over-temp conditions.

item.para: Using the EST, compare Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT), Engine Oil Temperature (EOT), Manifold Air Temperature (MAT), and Intake Air Temperature (IAT) with Key On Engine Off. All of the sensors should read within 1 Degree C (2 Degree F) of each other.

para.emph: NOTE: This is only accurate if done after a cold soak of at least 8 hours on the engine.

step1.para: Install a manual gauge or thermocouple in the port of the front cover, operate the engine, and use the EST to monitor ECT.

item.para: If both the EST and mechanical gauge read near the same temperature +/- 3° C (+/- 5° F), do step 5.
If mechanical gauge and EST read values with a difference greater than +/- 3° C (+/- 5° F), do Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics for the ECT circuit found in Section 7 of this manual.

step1.para: Run engine up to an operating temperature of at least 70° C (158° F). While monitoring ECT using the EST, instrument panel coolant temperature gauge and the mechanical gauge. Attempt to duplicate the operator's concern of coolant over-temp.

item.para: If instrument panel coolant temperature gauge reads a different temperature than the EST and mechanical gauge, refer to the Electrical System Troubleshooting Guide for the appropriate model and year of vehicle.
If mechanical gauge and EST read values with a difference greater than +/- 3° C (+/- 5° F), do Electronic Control Systems Diagnostics for ECT circuit found in Section 7 of this manual.
If concern cannot be duplicated, clean radiator fins (if not done previously). Flush the radiator fins with water on the cooling fan side of the radiator. Do not continue further with diagnostics.

caution.para: To avoid radiator damage, when using high pressure washer, be careful not to get wand to close to radiator fins.

item.para: If coolant over- temp is duplicated, do step 6.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury or possible death, use only the following procedure to remove the pressure type cap from the cooling system. Always allow the engine to cool first. Wrap a thick, heavy cloth around the cap. Loosen cap slowly; then pause a moment. This will avoid possible scalding by hot coolant or steam. Continue to turn cap to the left and remove.

step1.para: Install the radiator pressure tester on the deaeration tank and run engine at elevated idle. Monitor the pressure in the system using the tester gauge to see if pressure rises above normal value of deaeration tank cap.

item.para: If pressure is higher than the pressure rating of the cooling system cap, proceed to Combustion Leak to Coolant diagnostics in this section.
If pressure gauge reading is below pressure rating of system, do step 7.

step1.para: Remove and inspect thermostat following the procedure in the Engine Service Manual. Check for opening temperature.

item.para: Replace as needed. Retest for condition after repair.
If thermostat passes test, do step 8.

step1.para: Use vehicle diagnostics manual to review automatic transmission diagnostics.
If over-temp condition remains, remove radiator and have flow checked at radiator shop.

item.para: Retest engine for over-temp condition with repaired/replaced radiator.
